term_definitions.items: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.
The identifier of the departmental period of care to which this Composition belongs.
Portlet ID from which stores the information where was the composition saved.
Evidence in support of a problem/diagnosis
Specific individual criteria , normally coded terms.
A narrative description of supportive evidence.
Factors leading to the problem or diagnosis.
Additional status and contextual qualifiers factors related to a problem/diagnosis.
Episodicity is used within a primary care context to distinguish between ongoing and new episodes of a problem or diagnosis, primarily for public health or quality assessment purposes.
The degree to which the problem is active and relevant within the current clinical context.

Records temporal/evidential progress towards identification of the problem or diagnosis, recognising that precise identification may take time to evolve as increasing amounts of evidence become available.

A numeric or textual representation of the priority assigned to the problem, relative to other problems in a list. This may be used to sort items according to perceived clinical priority or to filter problems felt to be of greater /lesser significance.
A flag or text/ coded item recording whether this problem/diagnosis should be presented in a patient summary. Applications may implement this in a variety of ways.
The diagnosis has been made at the outset of the diagnostic process with limited evidence available.
The problem or diagnosis has been identified with some confidence but further evidence has yet to be considered.
The problem or diagnosis is made at the end of the diagnostic process taking into account all available significant evidence. It is not expected to change.
The assessed severity of the problem or diagnosis. Severity is always relative to the identified problem e.g 'Severe asthma' does not equate clinically to 'severe in-grown toenail'.
Description of the impact of the problem or diagnosis on the patient as a whole. Unlike 'severity' this can be used to compare the clinical impact of different problems.
The problem or diagnosis is currently active and clinically relevant.
The problem or diagnosis is not completely resolved but is inactive or felt less relevant to the current clinical context.
The problem or diagnosis is completely resolved and therefore not relevant to the current clinical context.
The level of confidence in the identification of the problem or diagnosis.
The first ever occurence of this problem or diagnosis.
A new occurence of an existing problem or diagnosis.
Part of an ongoing occurence of an existing problem or diagnosis.
The problem has had no impact on the subject.
The problem has had very little overall impact on the subject's life or health.
The problem has had considerable overall impact on the subject's life or health.
The problem has threatened the subject's life.
The severity of the index problem or diagnosis is mild, not affecting life or longevity.
The severity of the index problem or diagnosis is such as to cause significant morbidity.
The severity of the index problem or diagnosis has had a major effect on life and/or longevity.
A text comment on the active status e.g describing the circumstances or evidence for resolution of a problem.
The problem was fatal to the subject.
Any health care condition which may impact on to mental, physical health of patient
Identification of the problem or diagnoses. Should be used a coded text.
Narrative description or comments about clinical aspects of the problem/diagnoses
The phenomenon, substance, or organisem that is considered to be cause
Summary information about occurrence or exacerbations.
The frequency of occurrences or excerbation of the problem/diagnoses
The date of last occurrance or exacerbation
Cumulative number of occurrances or exacerbation
Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose
Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose
The date that problem/diagnose resolved or went to remission
The age of person at the time of ressolution
The age of the person when clinician assess the problem/diagnose
Slot to contain detailed and structured anatomical location details
The supporting criteria on which problem/diagnose based
Clinical stage or grade of problem
The type of relationship that this problem/diagnose has to the related itam

Slot to contain range of descriptors for context- or use-case specific labels or workflow-related aspects of the diagnostic process which may not be safe to exchange between systems or use in a shared environment. Examples include: active/inactive; primary/secondary; preliminary/provisional/working/final.
A future health state that is agreed to by the person
A future health state that is agreed to by the person. Aligned with ZN documentation.
The health state that is to be achieved. Normally a brief term.
The proposed date interval of achievement.
The range of values within the target
The proposed date interval for achieving the target
A textual comment on the desired target.
The date that this goal was established.
Further textual commetn on the desired goal.
The overall intent of the goal e.g curative, palliative, condition improvement, condition/therapeutic monitoring, personal support.
Progress towards the aceivment of a health goal.
The date at which progres towards the goal was assessed.
Detailed comment about progess towards the goal.
Estimate of of whether progress towards the goal is on schedule
Progress towards the goal is within the expected timeframe.
The goal is being acheived ahead of the expected timeframe
Goal acheivement appears to be progressing more slowly than anticipated.
A qualitative estimate of progression towards the goal.
Generic request for a range of different healthcare services e.g referral, lab request, equipment request.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
The date and time that the service should be performed or completed.
A short description of the reason for the request. This is often coded with an external terminology.
A narrative description explaining the reason for request.
Stated intent of the request by the referrer.
True indicates that additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available eg incomplete pathology test results.
Details of the nature of supplementary information that is to follow e.g name of laboratory results.
Local detailed information such as billing requirements.
Language, transport or other personal requirements to support the patient's attendance or participation in provision of the service.
Identification of the service requested. This is often coded with an external terminology.

The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.
A list of person's or organisation who should receive copies of any communication.
Structured detail defining the service requested eg CLUSTER archetype specifying the specific catheter that is to be inserted.
A detailed narrative description of the service requested.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
The latest date that is acceptable for the service to be completed.
The person or organisation making the request.
The person or organisation receiving the request.
The members of a notification/ distribution list, as individuals or as a category e.g 'GP'.
The communications mode by which the distribution is to be made.
Date that the distribution was sent.
An individual person or organisation to whom the distribution applies.
A named category of group e.g. Social work, patient representatives to whom the distribution applies.
Unique identifier for an individual recipient.
Distribution details for an individual recipient.
If true the notification should be made urgently.
Nursing process infrastructure for ZN nursing ACTION archetypes.
Details of materials used during the intervention.
The name of the material used
The quantity of material used - default derived from EAN terminology.
A clinical activity that has been carried out for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes.
Detailed structure describing the procedure carried out, including preparation and details about the method and equipment/devices used.
Was the intervention regarded as unsuccessful, from a clinical perspective? True if unsuccessful.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.
Multimedia representation of the procedure, including images.
The reason or indication for the procedure.
An unplanned event prior to or related to the procedure, which may affect its execution e.g patient self-removed cannula.
The number of failed attempts to perform the procedure.

Record information about unplanned or unexpected activities that needed to be done during the procedure. Record the name of the task and a description within this archetype, but detail should be recorded in specific linked INSTRUCTION or ACTION archetypes.
Description of additional task performed during the procedure.
Link to a detailed record of the additional task.
Narrative description about the procedure carried out.
Details about the anatomical site of procedure.
Identification of specific methods or techniques used for procedure or intervention.
Name of additional task performed during the procedure.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Descriptions of variance in the procedure performed from that requested.
Details of information required to support process and other local requirements.
To handle a Care plan structure where each problem/issue has a related goal.
Generic encounter or progress note composition

items.items: Generic encounter or progress note composition
Generic encounter or progress note composition
To handle a Care plan structure where each problem/issue has a related goal.
Za urejanje strukture plana nege v katerem je vsak problem/diagnoza povezan/a s svojim ciljem.
Any health care condition which may impact on to mental, physical health of patient
Identification of the problem or diagnoses. Should be used a coded text.
Narrative description or comments about clinical aspects of the problem/diagnoses
The phenomenon, substance, or organisem that is considered to be cause
Summary information about occurrence or exacerbations.
The frequency of occurrences or excerbation of the problem/diagnoses
The date of last occurrance or exacerbation
Cumulative number of occurrances or exacerbation
Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose
Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose
The date that problem/diagnose resolved or went to remission
The age of person at the time of ressolution
The age of the person when clinician assess the problem/diagnose
Slot to contain detailed and structured anatomical location details
The supporting criteria on which problem/diagnose based
Clinical stage or grade of problem
The type of relationship that this problem/diagnose has to the related itam
Vsa stanja pacienta, ki vplivajo na njegovo zdravje
Identificirani problem oz. diagnoza. Uporaba standardnih šifrantov je priporočljiva.
Opis kliničnih aspektov problema oz. diagnoze
*Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose(en)
*Further problems, diagnoses, procedures aotr events that related to th eproblem/diagnose(en)
Datum od katerega ta diagnoza ni več aktualna oz. problem ni več aktualen
Opis odnosa z povezanimi stanji pacienta
Evidence in support of a problem/diagnosis
Specific individual criteria , normally coded terms.
A narrative description of supportive evidence.
Factors leading to the problem or diagnosis.
Dokaz kot podpora diagnozi (za boljše raumevanje diagnoze)
FUNKCIONALNA STANJA IN VZORCI ZDRAVEGA OBNAŠANJA
Additional status and contextual qualifiers factors related to a problem/diagnosis.
Episodicity is used within a primary care context to distinguish between ongoing and new episodes of a problem or diagnosis, primarily for public health or quality assessment purposes.
The degree to which the problem is active and relevant within the current clinical context.

Records temporal/evidential progress towards identification of the problem or diagnosis, recognising that precise identification may take time to evolve as increasing amounts of evidence become available.

A numeric or textual representation of the priority assigned to the problem, relative to other problems in a list. This may be used to sort items according to perceived clinical priority or to filter problems felt to be of greater /lesser significance.
A flag or text/ coded item recording whether this problem/diagnosis should be presented in a patient summary. Applications may implement this in a variety of ways.

The problem or diagnosis is made at the end of the diagnostic process taking into account all available significant evidence. It is not expected to change.

Description of the impact of the problem or diagnosis on the patient as a whole. Unlike 'severity' this can be used to compare the clinical impact of different problems.
The problem or diagnosis is currently active and clinically relevant.
The problem or diagnosis is not completely resolved but is inactive or felt less relevant to the current clinical context.
The problem or diagnosis is completely resolved and therefore not relevant to the current clinical context.
The level of confidence in the identification of the problem or diagnosis.

Part of an ongoing occurence of an existing problem or diagnosis.

The problem has had considerable overall impact on the subject's life or health.

The severity of the index problem or diagnosis is such as to cause significant morbidity.
The severity of the index problem or diagnosis has had a major effect on life and/or longevity.
A text comment on the active status e.g describing the circumstances or evidence for resolution of a problem.
The problem was fatal to the subject.
Problem / diagnoza podana ob sprejemu pacienta
Problem / diagnoza podana v času hospitalizacije pacienta (med sprejemom in odpustom)
Problem / diagnoza podana ob odpustu pacienta
Ddiagnoza je trenutno aktivna in klinično relevantna
Zanesljivost opredeljenega problema oz. posatvljene diagnoze
Nova ponovitev starega problema/ ali diagnoze
Del epizode postavljene diagnoze lai problema
Diagnoz aoz problem je fatalen za pacienta
A future health state that is agreed to by the person
A future health state that is agreed to by the person. Aligned with ZN documentation.
The health state that is to be achieved. Normally a brief term.
The proposed date interval of achievement.
The range of values within the target
The proposed date interval for achieving the target

Bleženje napredka pri doseganju postavljenih ciljev
Generic request for a range of different healthcare services e.g referral, lab request, equipment request.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
The date and time that the service should be performed or completed.

Details of the nature of supplementary information that is to follow e.g name of laboratory results.

Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.

The latest date that is acceptable for the service to be completed.
The person or organisation making the request.
The person or organisation receiving the request.
Generični zahtevek za različne naloge v procesu zdravljenja
Datum in čas do kdaj, naj bi se naročilo izvedlo
Ali bodo dodatne informacije bodo naknadno dostavljene?
Opis oblike dodatnih informacij, ki bodo naknadno dostavljene
Lokalne podraobnosti za potrebe npr. obračuna..
Seznam ljudi, ki so vključeni v to komunikacijo in morajo biti obveščeni
A clinical activity that has been carried out for therapeutic or diagnostic purposes.
Detailed structure describing the procedure carried out, including preparation and details about the method and equipment/devices used.
Was the intervention regarded as unsuccessful, from a clinical perspective? True if unsuccessful.
Details about any complication arising from the procedure.
Multimedia representation of the procedure, including images.
The reason or indication for the procedure.
An unplanned event prior to or related to the procedure, which may affect its execution e.g patient self-removed cannula.
The number of failed attempts to perform the procedure.

Record information about unplanned or unexpected activities that needed to be done during the procedure. Record the name of the task and a description within this archetype, but detail should be recorded in specific linked INSTRUCTION or ACTION archetypes.
Description of additional task performed during the procedure.
Link to a detailed record of the additional task.
Narrative description about the procedure carried out.
Details about the anatomical site of procedure.
Identification of specific methods or techniques used for procedure or intervention.
Name of additional task performed during the procedure.
The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.
The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.
Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.
Descriptions of variance in the procedure performed from that requested.
Details of information required to support process and other local requirements.
Podroben opis izvedene aktivnosti, npr. priprave, uporabljena metoda, oprema in naprave
TRUE (resnično) pomeni, da aktivnost ni bila opravljena s kliničnega vidika
Nenačrtovan dogodek, npr. neželen dogodek, ki vpliva na aktivnost

Podatki o nenačrtovanih aktivnostih, katere je bilo potrebno izvesti med aktivnostjo. Ta arhetip zajema naziv in opis naloge, drugi podatki o nalogi pa naj se zapišejo v povezanih (link) arhetipih tipa INSTRUCTION ali ACTION
Opis dodatnih nalog med izvajanjem aktivnosti
Povazava na zapis o dodatni nalogi
Sent - poslana v task sezname izvajalcev
Suspend - zahteva trenutno miruje, lahko jo nadaljujemo v prihodnosti
Narrative description about the procedure carried out.
Podrobnosti o anatomski lokaciji, vezani na aktivnost
Naziv dodatne naloge, ki se je izvedla med aktivnostjo
Interni ID naročila, kot ga določi naročnik, npr. številka napotnice
Kdo je naročil aktivnost, posameznik ali organizacija
Interni ID naročila, kot ga določi prejemnik, npr. zap.št.pošte
Opis odstopanj med načrtovano in izvedeno aktivnostjo
Podrobnosti za podporo procesom in drugim lokalnim zahtavam (cluster)
Nursing process infrastructure for ZN nursing ACTION archetypes.
Details of materials used during the intervention.
The name of the material used
The quantity of material used - default derived from EAN terminology.
Infrastruktura za beleženje aktivnosti izvedenih v procesu zdravstvene nege ( "nursing ACTION archetypes")
Ime oseb, ki jih je potrebno obvestiti o izvedeni aktivnosti
The members of a notification/ distribution list, as individuals or as a category e.g 'GP'.
The communications mode by which the distribution is to be made.
Date that the distribution was sent.
An individual person or organisation to whom the distribution applies.
A named category of group e.g. Social work, patient representatives to whom the distribution applies.
Unique identifier for an individual recipient.
Distribution details for an individual recipient.
If true the notification should be made urgently.
Seznam prejemnikov - skupina posameznikov, ki so naslovniki sporočila
Posameznik ali organizacija, na koga je naslovljeno sporočilo
Ime skupine prejemnikov, npr. 'zdravniki predstojniki oddelkov'
Unikatni identifikator posameznika (primarni ključ, ki določa posameznika)
Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.
The identifier of the departmental period of care to which this Composition belongs.
Portlet ID from which stores the information where was the composition saved.

ID časa zdravljenja, ki mu pripada ta composition. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.(en)
ID časa zdravljenja na oddelku, ki mu pripada ta composition.
ID portleta v katerem so shranjene informacije o shranjenom composition-u.
